text: Yoav Raanan (יואב רענן; born January 15, 1928) is an Israeli former Olympic diver. He was born in Cairo, Egypt. ==Diving career== Raanan competed for Israel at the 1952 Summer Olympics, at the age of 24, in Helsinki, coming in 9th in Men's Springboard and 24th in Men's Platform. It was Israel's first appearance in the Olympic Games. Raanan participated for Israel at the 1954 Asian Games in Manila, Philippines, in diving, winning the gold medal in 3 m springboard and the silver medal in 10 m platform. He competed again for Israel at the 1956 Summer Olympics, at the age of 28, in Melbourne, coming in 22nd in Men's Springboard. Raanan was one of only three competitors representing Israel in those Games, as they took place weeks after the Sinai War. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:Possibly living people Category:Olympic divers of Israel Category:Divers at the 1956 Summer Olympics Category:Asian Games gold medalists for Israel Category:Asian Games silver medalists for Israel Category:Sportspeople from Cairo Category:Israeli male divers Category:Divers at the 1952 Summer Olympics Category:Divers at the 1954 Asian Games Category:Egyptian emigrants to Israel Category:Asian Games medalists in diving Category:Medalists at the 1954 Asian Games
title: Yoav Raanan
